questions.hint: Recall the differences between the two core OOP concepts: abstraction and encapsulation.

options.description: An object is an encapsulation because it packages data and behavior into one bundle.

An object is an encapsulation because it lets us think in terms of higher level concepts 
such as Students rather than student-related functions and data separately.

questions.description: OO is a higher level mechanism than the procedural paradigm.
questions.hint: OOP four core concepts are: Encapsulation, Abstraction, Inheritance and Polymorphism.
